answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you have asthma and allergy, in all probability you have developed contact dermatitis to some detergent. Wear gloves at work and see if it helps. Take an anti allergic.It can also be a peripheral neuropathy as in diabetes and thyroid disorders or a pinched nerve as in carpal tunnel syndrome. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: i work in a restaurant kitchen scrubbing pots, the morning after a long shift i woke up with swelling, burning pain, skin numbness and tingling in my hands & fingers. these symptoms persisted for most of the day and even 2 days later i still have stiff hands. I suffer with asthma & a skin rashes could this be related or maybe a reaction to detergent. Does anybody have any idea please..
title: tingling numb fingers
